answer_html: \(\int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx=\frac{\sin^{5} x}{5} - \frac{\sin^{7} x}{7} +C\) completing the question.
answer_latex: $\int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx=\frac{\sin^{5} x}{5} - \frac{\sin^{7} x}{7}  +C$ completing the question.
hints_html: The power of cosine is odd. Peel off a power then try a substitution.
hints_latex: The power of cosine is odd. Peel off a power then try a substitution.
hints_raw: The power of cosine is odd. Peel off a power then try a substitution.
question: 3 (d)
sols_html:
Notice that

\[\begin{aligned} \int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx &= \int (\cos^{2} x)(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx \\ &= \int (1-\sin^{2} x ))(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx\end{aligned}\]

So let \(u = \sin x\) so \(du = (\cos x)dx\). Thus,

\[\begin{aligned} \int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx &= \int (1-\sin^{2} x ))(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx \\ &= \int (1-u^{2} ))u^{4} \, du \\ &= \int u^{4}-u^{6} \, du \\ &= \frac{u^{5}}{5} - \frac{u^{7}}{7} +C\\ &= \frac{\sin^{5} x}{5} - \frac{\sin^{7} x}{7} +C\end{aligned}\]

completing the question.
sols_latex:
Notice that

\begin{align*}
\int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx &= \int (\cos^{2} x)(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx \\
&=  \int (1-\sin^{2} x ))(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx
\end{align*}

So let $u = \sin x$ so $du = (\cos x)dx$. Thus,

\begin{align*}
\int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx &=  \int (1-\sin^{2} x ))(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx \\
&= \int (1-u^{2} ))u^{4} \, du \\ 
&= \int u^{4}-u^{6} \, du \\
&= \frac{u^{5}}{5} - \frac{u^{7}}{7} +C\\
&= \frac{\sin^{5} x}{5} - \frac{\sin^{7} x}{7}  +C
\end{align*}

completing the question.
sols_raw:
Notice that

:<math> \begin{align}
\int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx &= \int (\cos^{2} x)(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx \\
&=  \int (1-\sin^{2} x ))(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx
\end{align} </math>

So let <math> u = \sin x </math> so <math> du = (\cos x)dx  </math>. Thus,

:<math> 
\begin{align}
\int (\cos^{3} x)(\sin^{4} x)\, dx &=  \int (1-\sin^{2} x ))(\sin^{4} x)\cos x \, dx \\
&= \int (1-u^{2} ))u^{4} \, du \\ 
&= \int u^{4}-u^{6} \, du \\
&= \frac{u^{5}}{5} - \frac{u^{7}}{7} +C\\
&= \frac{\sin^{5} x}{5} - \frac{\sin^{7} x}{7}  +C
\end{align}
</math>

completing the question.
